segments.content: Hi everyone!
segments.sourceMdx: Hi everyone!

segments.content: This week React Native takes the spotlight! But there are also interesting news from Vercel and PRs to take a look at from the React core team.
segments.sourceMdx: This week React Native takes the spotlight! But there are also interesting news from Vercel and PRs to take a look at from the React core team.
segments.translated_content: 本周React Native成为焦点！同时Vercel也发布了有趣的消息，React核心团队也有值得关注的PR。

segments.content: Earlier this week, I was at React/RN Connection conferences in Paris. It was great to meet some of you there!
segments.sourceMdx: Earlier this week, I was at React/RN Connection conferences in Paris. It was great to meet some of you there!
segments.translated_content: 本周早些时候，我参加了在巴黎举行的React/RN Connection会议。很高兴在那里见到你们中的一些人！

segments.content: The Parisian party is not over. After many years, the great [**dotJS conference**](https://www.dotjs.io/?utm_source=thisweekinreact) is back in Paris on June 27. They already announced great speakers, including Mark Dalgleish, Malte Ubl, Charlie Gerard, James Q Quick, Ben Lesh... Last regular tickets available, get a 10% discount with my code "TWIR".
segments.sourceMdx: The Parisian party is not over. After many years, the great [**dotJS conference**](https://www.dotjs.io/?utm_source=thisweekinreact) is back in Paris on June 27. They already announced great speakers, including Mark Dalgleish, Malte Ubl, Charlie Gerard, James Q Quick, Ben Lesh... Last regular tickets available, get a 10% discount with my code "TWIR".
segments.translated_content: 巴黎的派对尚未结束。时隔多年，盛大的[**dotJS大会**](https://www.dotjs.io/?utm_source=thisweekinreact)将于6月27日重返巴黎。他们已经宣布了重磅演讲嘉宾阵容，包括Mark Dalgleish、Malte Ubl、Charlie Gerard、James Q Quick、Ben Lesh等...普通门票即将售罄，使用我的优惠码"TWIR"可享9折。

segments.content: Due to the conf, I only had today to work on the newsletter. Thankfully my co-author [Benedikt](https://twitter.com/bndkt) took over and did most of the work this week! 🙏
segments.sourceMdx: Due to the conf, I only had today to work on the newsletter. Thankfully my co-author [Benedikt](https://twitter.com/bndkt) took over and did most of the work this week! 🙏
segments.translated_content: 由于会议缘故，我只有今天能处理新闻稿。幸好我的合著者[Benedikt](https://twitter.com/bndkt)接手并完成了本周大部分工作！🙏

segments.content: Next week, the newsletter takes a well-deserved break. We'll be back on May 8.
segments.sourceMdx: Next week, the newsletter takes a well-deserved break. We'll be back on May 8.
segments.translated_content: 下周，本刊将迎来应得的休刊期。我们将在5月8日回归。

segments.content: ## ⚛️ React
segments.sourceMdx: ## ⚛️ React {#react}

segments.content: [![Vercel reverted all edge rendering back to Node.js](/emails/issues/183/r183.jpg)](https://x.com/leeerob/status/1780705942734331983)
segments.sourceMdx: [![Vercel reverted all edge rendering back to Node.js](/emails/issues/183/r183.jpg)](https://x.com/leeerob/status/1780705942734331983)

segments.content: 🐦 [Vercel reverted all edge rendering back to Node.js](https://x.com/leeerob/status/1780705942734331983)
segments.sourceMdx: 🐦 [Vercel reverted all edge rendering back to Node.js](https://x.com/leeerob/status/1780705942734331983)

segments.content: Vercel’s VP of Product, Lee Rob, explained on X that Vercel is “reverting all edge rendering back to Node.js.” If you’re using Vercel (and probably even if you don’t), you’ll know that Vercel has pushed “edge” as a concept for a long time. On the one hand, edge means that compute is run near to where a user accessing a site hosted on Vercel is located. On the other hand, it also means that this compute is run on an “edge runtime,” which is built on V8 and not on Node.js. While the concept of running compute near to the end users sound appealing, the advantages quickly disappear if data needs to be loaded from a central location (which very often is the case). At the same time, development teams are often struggling to adapt workload to the limited subset of APIs available on the edge runtime. Now it seams Vercel has come to the conclusion that overall, the challenges for developers outweigh the limited benefits, and is therefore reverting to centralized Node.js runtimes. I appreciate their transparency around this! If you want more details, Theo made a [video](https://youtu.be/lAGE-k1Zfrg?si=5SP4hyoFkixTsh-y) about it.
segments.sourceMdx: Vercel’s VP of Product, Lee Rob, explained on X that Vercel is “reverting all edge rendering back to Node.js.” If you’re using Vercel (and probably even if you don’t), you’ll know that Vercel has pushed “edge” as a concept for a long time. On the one hand, edge means that compute is run near to where a user accessing a site hosted on Vercel is located. On the other hand, it also means that this compute is run on an “edge runtime,” which is built on V8 and not on Node.js. While the concept of running compute near to the end users sound appealing, the advantages quickly disappear if data needs to be loaded from a central location (which very often is the case). At the same time, development teams are often struggling to adapt workload to the limited subset of APIs available on the edge runtime. Now it seams Vercel has come to the conclusion that overall, the challenges for developers outweigh the limited benefits, and is therefore reverting to centralized Node.js runtimes. I appreciate their transparency around this! If you want more details, Theo made a [video](https://youtu.be/lAGE-k1Zfrg?si=5SP4hyoFkixTsh-y) about it.
segments.translated_content: Vercel产品副总裁Lee Rob在X平台解释，公司正在"将所有边缘渲染回退至Node.js"。如果你使用Vercel（甚至可能未使用），会注意到Vercel长期推崇"边缘"概念。一方面，边缘计算意味着在靠近访问Vercel托管网站用户的位置运行计算；另一方面，这也意味着计算运行在基于V8而非Node.js的"边缘运行时"上。虽然就近运行计算的概念很吸引人，但当数据需要从中心位置加载时（这种情况很常见），优势就迅速消失。同时，开发团队常常难以将工作负载适配到边缘运行时有限的API子集。现在Vercel似乎得出结论：对开发者而言，挑战超过了有限的好处，因此决定回归集中式Node.js运行时。我欣赏他们在这件事上的透明度！若需更多细节，Theo制作了相关[视频](https://youtu.be/lAGE-k1Zfrg?si=5SP4hyoFkixTsh-y)。

segments.content:
* 💸 [Clerk's prebuilt UI components give you a beautiful, fully-functional user management experience in minutes. Start for free!](https://go.clerk.com/AlkHHq8)
* 👀 [React Core PR - React 19 will not patch fetch() anymore!](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/28896): the controversial `fetch()` patch to deduplicate requests in RSCs is now removed from React core. You might see it as a good thing, but keep in mind you will now need to deduplicate requests yourself manually with `React.cache`.
* 👀 [React Core PR - Don't minify symbols in production builds](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/28881): React 19 production builds will preserve variable/function names and should become easier to read/debug. You can still minify it yourself if you want to, but using HTTP gzip compression should be enough to compensate for the extra size.
* 👀 [React Docs PR - Add documentation for ref cleanup function](https://github.com/reactjs/react.dev/pull/6770): React 19 ref functions can now return a cleanup function (🐦 [preview](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1783108366459375675)). This should also help users using string refs (removed in v19) and classes to migrate thanks to automated codemods.
* 👀 [Remix POC - Remix + Hono + Vite](https://github.com/yusukebe/hono-and-remix-on-vite)
* 🗓 [React Summit](https://reactsummit.com/?utm_source=thisweekinreact) - 🇳🇱 Amsterdam - 14-18 June - Get a 10% discount with code "TWIR". Awesome lineup including Evan Bacon, Kent C. Dodds, Theo, Tim Neutkens, Mark Erikson, Fred Schott and so many others!
* 📜 [HTML attributes vs DOM properties](https://jakearchibald.com/2024/attributes-vs-properties/): A great deep dive into subtle DOM behaviors and design decisions, including how frameworks like React or Vue handle the difference. Also explains how React 19 will improve support for Web Components.
* 📜 [Redwood - Building a new docs site with RSC](https://redwoodjs.com/blog/building-a-new-docs-site-with-rsc): Redwood is dogfooding Redwood by showing how to build a docs site with it, based on MDX and RSCs.
* 📜 [Deploy a new Remix app to Cloudflare Pages:](https://www.jacobparis.com/content/remix-cloudflare-pages) A lot has recently changed (and improved!) about how Remix can be deployed to CF Pages. This is a good guide on the state of the art.
* 📜 [Improving INP in React and Next.js](https://www.thisdot.co/blog/improving-inp-in-react-and-next-js): Interaction to Next Paint has recently replaced First Input Delay (FID) as a core web vital; this post details how to optimize it.
* 📜 [Did Signals Just Land in React?](https://thenewstack.io/did-signals-just-land-in-react/): Spoiler Alert: No, they didn't. But there’s still a way to try signals in React.
* 📜 [Vercel - Building an interactive 3D event badge with React Three Fiber](https://vercel.com/blog/building-an-interactive-3d-event-badge-with-react-three-fiber)
* 📜 [Getting the Current URL in Next.js Server Components](https://www.propelauth.com/post/getting-url-in-next-server-components)
* 📜 [How to manifest streamlined authentication: AWS Cognito in a React app](https://evilmartians.com/chronicles/how-to-manifest-streamlined-authentication-aws-cognito-in-a-react-app)
* 📜 [Localized link tags for SEO in Remix](https://react-japan.dev/en/blog/localized-link-tags-for-seo-in-remix)
* 📜 [How Solid Made Me A Better React Developer](https://www.brenelz.com/posts/how-solid-made-me-a-better-react-developer/)
* 📜 [Boosting Performance with Next.js and React Server Components - A GeekyAnts Case Study](https://geekyants.com/blog/boosting-performance-with-nextjs-and-react-server-components-a-geekyantscom-case-study)
* 📜 [How to Simplify Global State Management in React Using Jotai](https://thenewstack.io/how-to-simplify-global-state-management-in-react-using-jotai/)
* 📦 [Remix 2.9 - Single Fetch (unstable)](https://github.com/remix-run/remix/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md)
* 📦 [StyleX - 0.6.1 - Typed variables, fallback values, ESLint plugin](https://stylexjs.com/blog/v0.6.1)
* 📦 [Hydrogen April 2024 release - Analytics preview, stable Vite support, SEO updates, full-page caching](https://hydrogen.shopify.dev/update/april-2024)
* 📦 [Zustand-Slices - Assemble slices into a single store](https://github.com/zustandjs/zustand-slices)
* 📦 [Spoiled - Realistic Spoiler component for React.js](https://github.com/molefrog/spoiled)
* 🎙️ [Off The Main Thread Podcast: Putting React In The Browser](https://offthemainthread.tech/episode/putting-react-in-the-browser/)
* 🎥 [Jack Herrington - JS Built-in Signals In React and Svelte today!](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HSVcZa5yTKE)
* 🎥 [Ben Holmes - Vercel got it wrong](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_dtyYDwHAIc): Interesting take on the “edge” topic by Ben Holmes, detailing Cloudflare’s approach.

segments.translated_content:
- 💸 [Clerk的预制UI组件助您快速实现美观且功能完备的用户管理系统。立即免费试用！](https://go.clerk.com/AlkHHq8)
- 👀 [React核心PR - React 19将不再修补fetch()！](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/28896)：颇具争议的RSC请求去重`fetch()`补丁已从React核心移除。您可能认为这是件好事，但请注意现在需要手动通过`React.cache`实现请求去重。
- 👀 [React核心PR - 生产环境构建不再压缩符号名](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/28881)：React 19生产构建将保留变量/函数名称，更便于调试。您仍可自行压缩代码，但HTTP gzip压缩应足以抵消增加的体积。
- 👀 [React文档PR - 新增ref清理函数文档](https://github.com/reactjs/react.dev/pull/6770)：React 19的ref函数现在可返回清理函数（🐦 [预览](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1783108366459375675)）。该特性也有助于使用字符串ref（v19已移除）和类组件的用户通过自动化代码迁移工具升级。
- 👀 [Remix概念验证 - Remix + Hono + Vite](https://github.com/yusukebe/hono-and-remix-on-vite)
- 🗓 [React峰会](https://reactsummit.com/?utm_source=thisweekinreact) - 🇳🇱 阿姆斯特丹 - 6月14-18日 - 使用代码"TWIR"享9折。豪华阵容包括Evan Bacon、Kent C. Dodds、Theo、Tim Neutkens、Mark Erikson、Fred Schott等大咖！
- 📜 [HTML属性与DOM属性详解](https://jakearchibald.com/2024/attributes-vs-properties/)：深入解析DOM的微妙行为与设计决策，包括React/Vue等框架的处理差异。同时阐述React 19对Web Components的改进支持。
- 📜 [Redwood - 使用RSC构建全新文档站点](https://redwoodjs.com/blog/building-a-new-docs-site-with-rsc)：Redwood通过基于MDX和RSC构建文档站点的实践来验证自身框架。
- 📜 [将Remix应用部署至Cloudflare Pages](https://www.jacobparis.com/content/remix-cloudflare-pages)：近期Remix在CF Pages的部署方式有重大改进，本文是最佳实践指南。
- 📜 [React与Next.js的INP优化指南](https://www.thisdot.co/blog/improving-inp-in-react-and-next-js)：交互到下次绘制(INP)已取代首次输入延迟(FID)成为核心Web指标，本文详述优化策略。
- 📜 [Signals特性真的登陆React了吗？](https://thenewstack.io/did-signals-just-land-in-react/)：剧透预警：并没有。但仍有方式在React中尝试signals。
- 📜 [Vercel - 使用React Three Fiber构建3D交互式活动徽章](https://vercel.com/blog/building-an-interactive-3d-event-badge-with-react-three-fiber)
- 📜 [在Next.js服务端组件中获取当前URL](https://www.propelauth.com/post/getting-url-in-next-server-components)
- 📜 [React应用集成AWS Cognito身份验证实战](https://evilmartians.com/chronicles/how-to-manifest-streamlined-authentication-aws-cognito-in-a-react-app)
- 📜 [Remix中实现SEO友好的本地化链接标签](https://react-japan.dev/en/blog/localized-link-tags-for-seo-in-remix)
- 📜 [Solid如何让我成为更优秀的React开发者](https://www.brenelz.com/posts/how-solid-made-me-a-better-react-developer/)
- 📜 [Next.js与RSC性能优化实践 - GeekyAnts案例研究](https://geekyants.com/blog/boosting-performance-with-nextjs-and-react-server-components-a-geekyantscom-case-study)

segments.content: ## 💸 Sponsor
segments.sourceMdx: ## 💸 Sponsor {#sponsor2}

segments.content: [![NLUX ― New React Library To Simplify Adding AI Features](/emails/issues/183/nlux.jpg)](https://nlux.dev/?c-twr2-h)
segments.sourceMdx: [![NLUX ― New React Library To Simplify Adding AI Features](/emails/issues/183/nlux.jpg)](https://nlux.dev/?c-twr2-h)

segments.content: **[NLUX ― New React Library To Simplify Adding AI Features](https://nlux.dev/?c-twr2-h)**
segments.sourceMdx: **[NLUX ― New React Library To Simplify Adding AI Features](https://nlux.dev/?c-twr2-h)**

segments.content: [NLUX](https://nlux.dev?c-twr2-p1) is an [open-source](https://github.com/nluxai/nlux) React library that makes it super simple to integrate powerful large language models (LLMs) like ChatGPT into your web app or website. With just a few lines of code, you can add conversational AI capabilities.
segments.sourceMdx: [NLUX](https://nlux.dev?c-twr2-p1) is an [open-source](https://github.com/nluxai/nlux) React library that makes it super simple to integrate powerful large language models (LLMs) like ChatGPT into your web app or website. With just a few lines of code, you can add conversational AI capabilities.
segments.translated_content: [NLUX](https://nlux.dev?c-twr2-p1) 是一个[开源](https://github.com/nluxai/nlux)的React库，它能极简地将ChatGPT等强大语言模型(LLM)集成到您的Web应用或网站中。仅需几行代码，即可添加对话式AI功能。

segments.content: Key features 🌟 include:
segments.sourceMdx: Key features 🌟 include:

segments.content:
* **Build AI Chat Interfaces In Minutes** - High quality conversational AI interfaces with a few lines of code.
* **React Components & Hooks** - `<AiChat />` for UI and `useChatAdapter` hook for easy integration.
* **Flexible Adapters** - For `ChatGPT`, `LangChain` and `HuggingFace`, and an API to **Create Your Own Adapter** for any backend.
* **Synchronise UI state with AI backends** in an optimal way.
* **Markdown Streaming** - Render LLM markdown as it's being generated.
* **Zero Dependencies** - Lightweight codebase.
segments.sourceMdx:
- **Build AI Chat Interfaces In Minutes** - High quality conversational AI interfaces with a few lines of code.
- **React Components & Hooks** - `<AiChat />` for UI and `useChatAdapter` hook for easy integration.
- **Flexible Adapters** - For `ChatGPT`, `LangChain` and `HuggingFace`, and an API to **Create Your Own Adapter** for any backend.
- **Synchronise UI state with AI backends** in an optimal way.
- **Markdown Streaming** - Render LLM markdown as it's being generated.
- **Zero Dependencies** - Lightweight codebase.
segments.translated_content:
- **分钟级构建AI聊天界面** - 通过少量代码创建高质量的对话式AI界面
- **React组件与钩子** - 提供`<AiChat />`组件和`useChatAdapter`钩子便于集成
- **灵活适配器** - 支持`ChatGPT`、`LangChain`和`HuggingFace`，并提供API可**为任意后端创建自定义适配器**
- **UI状态与AI后端优化同步**
- **Markdown流式渲染** - 实时呈现LLM生成的Markdown
- **零依赖** - 轻量级代码库

segments.content: More info, examples and documentation on [nlux.dev](https://nlux.dev?c-twr2-p1)
segments.sourceMdx: More info, examples and documentation on [nlux.dev](https://nlux.dev?c-twr2-p1)
segments.translated_content: 更多信息、示例和文档请访问 [nlux.dev](https://nlux.dev?c-twr2-p1)

segments.content: ## 📱 React-Native
segments.sourceMdx: ## 📱 React-Native {#react-native}

segments.content: [![React Native 0.74 released, React Native IDE is now in beta](/emails/issues/183/rn183.jpg)](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2024/04/22/release-0.74)
segments.sourceMdx: [![React Native 0.74 released, React Native IDE is now in beta](/emails/issues/183/rn183.jpg)](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2024/04/22/release-0.74)
segments.translated_content: [![React Native 0.74发布，React Native IDE进入测试阶段](/emails/issues/183/rn183.jpg)](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2024/04/22/release-0.74)

segments.content: 📦 [React Native 0.74 released](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2024/04/22/release-0.74)
segments.sourceMdx: 📦 [React Native 0.74 released](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2024/04/22/release-0.74)

segments.content: This week saw the release of React Native 0.74, a major milestone for the community! The latest version makes “bridgeless mode” the default for new projects using the New Architecture (with the next release, 0.75, the New Arch will become the default, too). Both can still be turned off if needed, but they clearly represent the future of React Native, and over the last months especially, A LOT of libraries have added support for both. But there’s more: RN 0.74 includes Yoga 3.0. There are very few breaking changes and deprecations, but it’s still worth checking them out in the [release notes](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2024/04/22/release-0.74).
segments.sourceMdx: This week saw the release of React Native 0.74, a major milestone for the community! The latest version makes “bridgeless mode” the default for new projects using the New Architecture (with the next release, 0.75, the New Arch will become the default, too). Both can still be turned off if needed, but they clearly represent the future of React Native, and over the last months especially, A LOT of libraries have added support for both. But there’s more: RN 0.74 includes Yoga 3.0. There are very few breaking changes and deprecations, but it’s still worth checking them out in the [release notes](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2024/04/22/release-0.74).
segments.translated_content: 本周React Native 0.74正式发布，这是社区的重要里程碑！新版在新架构项目中默认启用"无桥模式"(bridgeless mode)，下个版本0.75还将默认启用新架构(New Arch)。两者仍可手动关闭，但它们显然代表着React Native的未来方向。过去几个月大量库已添加对两者的支持。此外，RN 0.74还包含Yoga 3.0，破坏性变更极少，但仍建议查阅[发布说明](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2024/04/22/release-0.74)了解详情。

segments.content: 📦 [React Native IDE is now in beta](https://ide.swmansion.com/)
segments.sourceMdx: 📦 [React Native IDE is now in beta](https://ide.swmansion.com/)

segments.content: Another exciting news this week is the closed beta for React Native IDE, developed by the team at Software Mansion. You can now sign up to get early access to the IDE. They also have a landing page up now, and the [docs](https://ide.swmansion.com/docs/getting-started) are publicly available for anyone curious about it.
segments.sourceMdx: Another exciting news this week is the closed beta for React Native IDE, developed by the team at Software Mansion. You can now sign up to get early access to the IDE. They also have a landing page up now, and the [docs](https://ide.swmansion.com/docs/getting-started) are publicly available for anyone curious about it.
segments.translated_content: 另一激动人心的消息是Software Mansion团队开发的React Native IDE已启动封闭测试。现可申请获取早期访问资格。[文档](https://ide.swmansion.com/docs/getting-started)已公开，供开发者了解其功能特性。

* 📜 [Sunrising New Architecture in the New Expensify App](https://blog.swmansion.com/sunrising-new-architecture-in-the-new-expensify-app-729d237a02f5): Super cool to see a complex open-source app adapting the New Arch. A great example to look into!
* 📜 [Apple privacy manifest for React Native](https://dev.to/dannyhw/apple-privacy-manifest-for-react-native-29fk): I’ve mentioned the Apple Privacy Manifest requirement before; finally, a good blog post summarizes the topic.
